Most popular.desc: create a new page (desktop apps only).

Most popular.mac: cmd + shift + N or use cmd + click
Most popular.win: ctrl + shift + N or use ctrl + click

Most popular.desc: open search or jump to a recently viewed page.

Markdown style.mac: Type ** on either side of your text
Markdown style.win: Type ** on either side of your text

Markdown style.mac: Type * on either side of your text
Markdown style.win: Type * on either side of your text

Markdown style.mac: Type ` on either side of your text
Markdown style.win: Type ` on either side of your text

Markdown style.mac: Type ~ on either side of your text
Markdown style.win: Type ~ on either side of your text

Markdown style.desc: create a to-do checkbox. (There's no space in between.)

Create and style your content.desc: create a line break within a block of text.
create a divider. (Three dashes in a row.)

Create and style your content.mac: With text selected, cmd + shift + S
Create and style your content.win: With text selected, ctrl + shift + S

Create and style your content.desc: add a link. You can also paste a URL over selected text to turn it into a link using cmd/ctrl+v.

Create and style your content.mac: Type /turn at the beginning or end of a block
Create and style your content.win: Type /turn at the beginning or end of a block
Create and style your content.desc: turn it into a different type of block.

Create and style your content.mac: Type /color at the beginning or end of any text block
Create and style your content.win: Type /color at the beginning or end of any text block
Create and style your content.desc: change its color or highlight color. (To remove a color or highlight, just type /default.) Example: /blue, /blue background
create a new page, or turn whatever you have on a line into a page.
go up one level in the page hierarchy.

Create and style your content.mac: holding option/alt as drag and drop
Create and style your content.win: holding option/alt as drag and drop
Create and style your content.desc: Duplicate any content on a Notion page

Edit and move blocks.desc: select the block you're currently in or clear selected blocks.
select the block your cursor is in.
open a selected image in full-screen. Or exit full-screen.

Edit and move blocks.mac: Hold down shift + up/down arrow keys
Edit and move blocks.win: Hold down shift + up/down arrow keys
Edit and move blocks.desc: expand your selection up or down.

Edit and move blocks.mac: Use cmd + shift + click on Mac, and alt + shift + click on Windows/Linux
Edit and move blocks.win: Use cmd + shift + click on Mac, and alt + shift + click on Windows/Linux
Edit and move blocks.desc: select or de-select an entire block.
select another block and all blocks in between.
edit any text inside a selected block (or open a page inside a page).

edit or change one or more selected blocks (change the type of block, the color, or edit, duplicate, or move the block). You'll see a text box at the top of the menu that pops up. Just type the action, block or color you want.

Edit and move blocks.mac: In board view, select multiple cards then use cmd + /
Edit and move blocks.win: In board view, select multiple cards then use ctrl + /
Edit and move blocks.desc: edit them all at once. Example: Here's how you'd change the status of several tasks at a time.
expand or close all toggles in a toggle list.
apply the last text or highlight color you used.
modify the current block you're in. Modify: Open a page, Check or uncheck a to-do checkbox, Open or close a toggle list item, Make embeds or images full-screen

@ commands.desc: Type @ and another workspace member's name to get their attention on something. They'll be notified. Useful in comments and discussions.
Type @ and the name of another page in your workspace to create a link to it. If you change the name of the page, this link will automatically change too.
Type @ and a date in any format (or "yesterday," "today" or "tomorrow," or even "next Wednesday"). Helpful for giving yourself due dates.

Type @remind followed by a date in any format (including "yesterday," "today," "tomorrow," etc.). You can click on the link that appears to adjust the date and exact time you want to be reminded. You'll receive a notification at that time.
dismiss the @-command menu if you simply want to type @.

[[ commands.desc: Type [[ and the name of another page in your workspace to create a link to it. If you change the name of the page, this link will automatically change too.
Type [[ and the name of the sub-page you want to nest within your current page. Use your cursor or arrow keys to select + Add new sub-page in the dropdown that appears.

[[ commands.mac: Create a new page somewhere else
[[ commands.win: Create a new page somewhere else
[[ commands.desc: Type [[ and the name of the page you want to create. Use your cursor or arrow keys to select  Add new page in... in the dropdown that appears, then select the page or database where you'd like that page to be added.

Slash commands Basic.desc: creates a new page (and will open it automatically when you press enter).
creates a to-do list with checkboxes.
creates a quote block of larger text.
creates a link to another page in your workspace.
clears the / menu. Handy if you're just trying to use a / in your writing.

Slash commands Inline.desc: lets you mention a page or a person in your workspace
lets you add a timestamp or reminder to your page
lets you add a TeX formula in line with your text

Slash commands Database.desc: creates a database table inside a current page.
creates a Kanban board inside a current page.
creates a calendar inside a current page.
creates a list-style database inside a current page.
creates a gallery inside a current page.
creates a timeline inside a current page.

Slash commands Database.mac: Any of the above + -full instead of -inline
Slash commands Database.win: Any of the above + -full instead of -inline
Slash commands Database.desc: to open that type of database view in its own page automatically. For example: /table-full, /board-full

creates a linked database — a copy of an existing database that you can insert into any page in-line and filter or view however you want. Helpful for creating multiple excerpts from the same database on the same page.

Slash commands Media.desc: bring up the option to upload or embed an image, or add one from Unsplash.
lets you paste in a URL to any PDF so it will display in-line on your page.
lets you paste in a URL to any website to create a web bookmark.
lets you upload a video file or embed a video from YouTube, Vimeo, etc.
lets you upload an audio file or embed a recording from SoundCloud, Spotify, etc.
creates a code block where you can write and copy any snippet of code.
lets you upload any file from your computer or create an embed.
lets you add any one of the 500+ embeds that work with Notion.

Slash commands Advanced.desc: lets you create a comment on any block.
creates an exact copy of the current block.
lets you move that block to a different page.
creates a Table of Contents block.
gives you a template button that duplicates any combination of blocks you define.
inserts a breadcrumb menu that shows where your current page is in your workspace.
lets you write mathematical equations and symbols using TeX.

@ 命令.desc: Type @ and another workspace member's name to get their attention on something. They'll be noriginDtified. Useful in comments and discussions.

Type @remind followed by a date in any format (including "yesterday," "today," "tomorrow," etc.). You can click on the link that appears to adjust the date and exact time you woriginDnt to be reminded. You'll receive a notification at that time.
